text: Degraded CGN Induced - <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Production by Monocytes In Vitro

text: In order to study the capacity of dCGN to stimulate <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production , peripheral blood monocytes were cultivated in the presence of dCGN ( 0.1 to 1 mg / ml ) .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation stimulate <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme TNF-alpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: Very low levels of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were induced in PBM after stimulation with native CGN ( Fig . 2A ) .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation induced <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme TNF-alpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation stimulation <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme induced <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: Addition of 0.1 mg / ml 10 kDa dCGN resulted in approximately a 60-fold increase in <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production by PBM .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation resulted <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme increase <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation increase <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme TNF-alpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: This was a dose - dependent effect that reached a 180-fold increase when cells were exposed to 1 mg / ml of 10 kDa dCGN ( Fig . 2A ) .
A 250-fold increase in <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production was detected at 1 mg / ml 40 kDa dCGN ( Fig . 2A ) .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation increase <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme TNF-alpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production increased in time reaching a maximum level at 8 hours of culture ( Figure 2B ) .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme TNF-alpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation increased <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: After 24 h , the amount of secreted <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was still one third of the total <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) , a known activator of immune cells also induced <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production with similar kinetics as dCGN ( Fig . 2B ) .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation induced <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme TNF-alpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: However , the amount of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> produced by LPS was 4-fold less than the one produced by dCGN and it was not detected after 8 hours of culture ( Fig . 2B ) .

text: Similarly , monocytic THP-1 cells cultivated in the presence of variable concentration of dCGN showed an increase in <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production ( Fig . 2C ) .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation increase <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme TNF-alpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: This increase in <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production was significantly smaller ( about 10-fold ) than the one presented by PBM ( Fig . 2A ) .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation This increase <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme TNF-alpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: No <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was released from THP-1 cells exposed to native CGN ( not shown ) .
<extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production by THP-1 cells was not dose dependent to the amount of dCGN used .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme TNF-alpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Regulation dependent <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: Also there was no difference between the two forms ( 10 and 40 kDa ) of dCGN ( Fig . 2C ) .

Interestingly , <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> release from THP-1 cells stimulated with dCGN reached a maximum level at 32 h , while stimulation with LPS reached a maximum level at 56 h ( Fig . 2D ) .
